choices: Avoid any movement and wait to see what happens
Navigate your way out of the room
Exhaustion might have caused the illusion. Try to sleep
1.content:
The night was almost quiet, with the addition of cars honking and the sound of the wind blowing from outside my apartment window. My room was lit by the street lights outside... I couldn't sleep. I was suffering from a severe case of insomnia. I tried taking sleep medication but nothing worked, so I stay sitting up on my bed with the soft covers barely hanging on me. The beams of light that knowingly intrude my room were enough for me to see that my phone on my desk had been blinking. I lazily got up from my bed and touched the cold floor and I walked to the desk. I sniffled and picked up my phone. Then I saw the most peculiar thing,... it was weird. I rubbed my eyes to make sure what I was seeing was real. Supposedly I had over 100 missed calls but only had one voice message. I used the voice message app on my phone to listen to it.

There was nothing but silence.

Pure SILENCE.

Right before the message ended there was a faint humming sound, then came the static. I pulled the phone away from my ear...

I was just thinking to myself ", What the hell?"

Suddenly my phone started to heat up. Soon enough it got to a point where my hand was burning so I dropped it. I saw the tiny pieces and frame of my phone shatter on impact with the floor. My hand was on fire... like it was fucking burning. I ran to the bathroom to find something in my medicine cabinet but that failed. I frantically searched for something to fix my hand and as I was flipping over every nook and crannie, I heard a guttural noise. I slowly opened the bathroom door and witnessed something that ought to come from a horror/supernatural movie.

There was something forming around my phone.

It looked like a void. A portal.

I gasped. My heart was thumping. I was terrified.

The aura around my phone glowed a vibrant red. Just like a sequence, the empty space inside the aura was filled in with blackness.

"Holy shit," was all I could say.

Before my very eyes, a hand appeared in the middle of the black space that darkened my room.

What's gonna happen? What am I gonna do?
1.title: The Beginning

info.description:
It's another lonely night and you're in bed. You can't fall asleep, you try many different methods but none are working. Suddnly, you see your cellphone blinking. You turn it on to see... well, I'll leave that for later.

You are the main character. You have to find out what's going on.
